instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2936B: What is 820-2936B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1.14V
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power

Replaced SMC
Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>


<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 16.74V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.46V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1.12v


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (voltages)
1      15.51V
2       16.37V
3       3.95V
4      3.46V
5       3.03V
6       3.23V
7       0.014V
8       0.189V
9        0.030V
10      3.49V
11      3.46V
12      3.46V
13      3.43V
14      3.29V
15      0.072V
16      1.30V
17      1.12V
18      1.12V
19      5V
20      5V
21      0.072V
22      0V
23      1.12V
24      5V
25       5V
26        1.14V
27       1.14V
28        1.14V



<RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR> = OK 100K
<RESISTOR>R7016</RESISTOR> = OK = 3K
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> = 2K
<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> = 2K

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1.14V
threads.message:
Stop to change components without reason!

Remove F7040 and check <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> voltage.
Post diode mode to ground on both pads of F7040.
Also post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
